TI: [Sex difference in performance in elevated plus maze and hippocampal GluR1 level].
AB: OBJECTIVE: To explore whether sex difference exists in the performance in each arm of elevated plus maze (EPM) and GluR1 level in the hippocampus of female and male Sprague-Dawley rats. METHODS: Eleven male and 10 female SD rats were tested for 5 minutes in the EPM. These rats were decapitated 30 min after testing. The left and right hippocampus were dissected. Samples were stored at -80 degree for protein extracting. Western blot was used to detect the GluR1 levels in the hippocampus. RESULTS: Female rats exhibited less anxiety-like behaviors than male rats in the EPM (P<0.05).Female rats had lower GluR1 levels in total and left hippocampus than those of male rats (P<0.05). CONCLUSION: Sex difference exists between female and male rats in the EPM and hippocampal GluR1.
AD: Department of Psychiatry, Second Xiangya Hospital, Central South University, Changsha 410011, China.
TA: Zhong Nan Da Xue Xue Bao Yi Xue Ban
